metadata.titel_preek: Advent: The Season of Shadows and the Coming Power

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks into a dark, resistant world to reclaim His household and create a new people through the arrival of the Messiah.

subject.identificatie: God / The One Who Comes (Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: It is he who put the whole operation in motion
A power from outside is coming... able to make a new creation
It is God’s power that gives good deeds

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Redemption of the Household
tekstueel_bewijs: to make a new creation out of people like us
The master, who established the household in the first place
solidarity with other human beings who... receive mercy
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one who receives mercy/power).

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Holy Spirit (implied power)
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the preacher is merely the witness/helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes indwelling power.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Powers of Darkness / Human Resistance / Sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'head-on collision' with cosmic darkness and the 'whole frame of this world passing away'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the church: staying awake and bearing fruit.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly fueled by the primary program (God's power). The preacher states: 'We are able to repent... because he is coming.'

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: John the Baptist → Christ ← Powers of Darkness

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We put him on a cross.

voorbeelden: He must not find us asleep.
more interested in making Christian hope known
The Advent clock tells the church what time it is.
I need power from outside myself to make me different.
A power... that is able to make a new creation.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon acknowledges the 'Devoir' (Must) but identifies the human lack of 'Pouvoir' (Power), positioning God as the sole provider of the capacity to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'absence of God' (~S1) through the 'collision' (S1 vs S2) to the 'new creation' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'One Who Comes' who provides the power that the Subject lacks.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; darkness is described as a cosmic reality, not just a metaphor.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects the idea that human effort or even human repentance can save, attributing all agency to the 'power from outside.'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is God’s power that gives... faith and repentance.
The preacher is nothing; the Word is everything.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is not presented as a hero to imitate, but as a 'beam of light' that disappears to show Christ.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: John the Baptist (as witness, not moral hero)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John is an actant of Transmission (Sender/Helper) rather than the Subject of the narrative.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-improvement; focus on the sufficiency of Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God works in us what He requires of us).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The ethical imperatives are perfectly nested within the soteriological indicative.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Master is away' and 'The Master is at the door'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The kingdom of God is in head-on collision with the powers of darkness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (Power from outside) grants the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an 'absence of God' and a 'darkness' that humans cannot escape on their own.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's arrival. Humans are actants of reception and secondary response.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current focus on the hearer as the one 'in solidarity' with those needing mercy.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this; it is the core of the grace-message.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Keep awake' (Devoir) never sounds like a condition for the 'Coming' (Subject's action).

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The cosmic nature of the opponent justifies the radical nature of the grace offered.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject of the active verbs while still calling for a radical human response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'darkness' imagery, semiotics reveals that the darkness is an Opponent that only a Subject-switch (to God) can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'metanoia'; semiotics shows that 'metanoia' is a modal competence (Pouvoir) granted by the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that even when the preacher says 'You must repent,' she immediately reassigns the 'Power' to God, preventing the sermon from sliding into moralism.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by turning John the Baptist into a functional actant (Helper/Witness) rather than a moral Subject.
